intro: Barbarea barbarea, commonly known as common rockcress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed or toothed, with small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Barbarea barbarea is adapted to cold climates and is known for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
